title: Homemade Masala Dosa
description: A delicious South Indian breakfast dish.

instructions.text: Soak rice and urad dal overnight.
Grind to make a batter and ferment.

title: Medu Vada (Savory Lentil Donuts)
description: Crispy on the outside, soft on the inside South Indian lentil fritters.

instructions.text: Soak urad dal for 2 hours. Drain well.
Grind dal to a thick, fluffy batter with minimal water.
Mix in onion, chilies, ginger, curry leaves, salt, pepper.
Wet hands, shape batter into donut shapes (with a hole in the center).
Deep fry in hot oil until golden brown and crispy.

title: Kerala Style Fish Curry (Meen Curry)
description: A tangy and spicy fish curry cooked in coconut milk, typical of Kerala cuisine.

instructions.text: Soak kudampuli in warm water.
Sauté shallots, ginger, garlic, green chilies.
Add spice powders (chili, turmeric, coriander). Sauté briefly.
Add thin coconut milk, soaked kudampuli, salt. Bring to a simmer.
Add fish pieces, cook until done. Finish with thick coconut milk and curry leaves tempering.

title: Bisi Bele Bath
description: A flavorful Karnataka dish made with rice, lentils, vegetables, and a special spice powder.

instructions.text: Cook rice and dal together until mushy.
Cook vegetables separately until tender.
Mix cooked rice/dal, vegetables, tamarind pulp, Bisi Bele Bath powder, salt, jaggery.
Add water to adjust consistency, simmer for 10 minutes.
Prepare tempering (ghee, mustard seeds, curry leaves, cashews) and add to the dish.

title: Pesarattu (Green Moong Dal Dosa)
description: A healthy dosa variation made from green moong dal, popular in Andhra Pradesh.

instructions.text: Soak green moong dal and rice overnight or for 6-8 hours.
Grind soaked dal, rice, ginger, green chilies, cumin seeds, salt to a smooth batter (add water as needed).
Optionally mix in finely chopped onions.
Heat a tawa (griddle), pour a ladleful of batter, and spread thinly like a dosa.
Drizzle oil/ghee, cook until crisp and golden brown. Serve hot with chutney.

title: Avial (Mixed Vegetable Coconut Stew)
description: A traditional Kerala dish with mixed vegetables cooked in a coconut-yogurt base.

ingredients.name: Mixed Vegetables (Yam, Plantain, Drumstick, Carrot, Beans)

instructions.text: Cut vegetables into thick, long strips.
Cook vegetables with turmeric powder and salt until just tender (don't overcook).
Grind coconut, green chilies, and cumin seeds to a coarse paste.
Add coconut paste to cooked vegetables, mix well, cook for 2 minutes.
Whisk yogurt and add it to the mixture. Heat gently (don't boil). Finish with coconut oil and curry leaves.
